newsitem.title: UK: Meyer Intl chairman and CEO to retire.
newsitem.headline: Meyer Intl chairman and CEO to retire.

text.p: British building materials and timber company Meyer International Plc said on Wednesday its chief executive, John Dobby, would retire at the end of December after 39 years with the group.
Chief operating officer Alan Peterson will succeed Dobby, the company said in a statement.
Chairman Harry Langman will retire in September and be succeeded by non-executive director Tony Palmer.
Palmer was chief executive of Taylor Woodrow Plc until his retirement this month, Meyer said.
The retirements followed a number of management changes at Meyer this year, including the previous appointment of John Edwards as finance director.
Meyer posted a pretax profit of 45.4 million stg for the year to March 31 compared to 37.6 million stg before exceptional charges. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
